business.headline: ICICI Bank raises minimum balance to Rs 50,000: What RBI governor saidICICI Bank has raised the minimum balance from Rs 10,000 to Rs 50,000. In semi-urban branches, it has gone up from Rs 5,000 to Rs 25,000. In rural branches, the requirement is now Rs 10,000.

Air India to suspend Delhi-Washington direct flights from September 1Despite the halt of the direct Delhi-Washington service, Air India will continue offering one-stop flights to Washington via partner airlines Alaska Airlines, United Airlines, and Delta Air Lines.
Sensex ends 746 points up, Nifty above 24,500; Tata Motors gains 3%The S&P BSE Sensex added 746.29 points to close at 80,604.08, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 221.75 points to end at 24,585.05.

Equity mutual fund inflows soar to record high in July. Check detailsNet flows into equity schemes rose 81% month-on-month to Rs 42,702 crore in July, data from the Association of Mutual Funds in India (AMFI) showed. Overall, assets under management in the mutual fund industry hit a record high at Rs 75.36 lakh crore.

Sensex gains 700 points: Why is stock market rising today?The rally was led by public sector banking and auto sector stocks. Banking stocks were in focus after State Bank of India (SBI) posted strong Q1 results, which prompted positive commentary from brokerages.

From health insurance and tax: 7 money-related myths decodedFrom health insurance and tax filing to investing and retirement planning, understanding the truth behind common myths can help you make confident, well-informed decisions for your future.

ITR-5 excel utility opens: What is it and who must fileIf filing physically, taxpayers must verify the return by sending the signed ITR-V form to the Centralised Processing Centre (CPC) in Bengaluru within 30 days, unless they choose to e-verify instead.

Why 'Make in India' still depends so much on 'Made in China'When Prime Minister Narendra Modi launched the 'Make in India' programme in 2014, it was meant to transform India into a global manufacturing hub, create millions of jobs, and reduce dependence on imports, especially from China.

From ban to profit sharing: Inside US deal with Nvidia, AMD on China chip salesThe deal makes the US a direct financial beneficiary of sensitive technology sales to a geopolitical rival. This article looks into the key details of this first-of-its-kind agreement.

ICICI Bank new minimum balance rules: FAQs, charges, and key informationIn metro and urban branches, the minimum average balance will jump from Rs 10,000 to Rs 50,000. For semi-urban areas, it will increase from Rs 5,000 to Rs 25,000.

Borrowed cash from a friend? You may end up paying income tax penaltyThe income tax department is strict when it comes to large cash transactions. Whether it's taking a loan, repaying one, or even making donations, there are limits you need to follow. Go beyond those, and you could face a penalty equal to the entire amount involved.

BlueStone Jewellery IPO opens for bidding: Should you subscribe?The IPO consists of a fresh issue of 1.59 crore shares worth Rs 820 crore and an offer for sale of 1.39 crore shares worth Rs 720.65 crore.

entertainment.headline: Dhadak 2 Anubha Fatehpuria: Impossible to be unaware of casteism in today's timeBollywood actor Anubha Fatehpuria shares her experience playing a mother confronting casteism in 'Dhadak 2'. She also discusses the challenges of juggling her acting and architecture careers while highlighting cinema's role in social change.

Ibrahim Ali Khan lacks depth, says Sarzameen co-star: My role was reduced to nothingActor Piloo Vidyarthi, who recently featured in the action-thriller 'Sarzameen' expressed disappointment over her scenes being trimmed in the final cut. She also reflected on actor Ibrahim Ali Khan's acting skills following the mixed reactions to his performance.

Bosco Martis on Hrithik vs Jr NTR in War 2: It celebrates two incredible performersChereographer Bosco Martis spoke about his experience of working with actors Hrithik Roshan and Jr NTR in 'War 2'. He also opened up about the making of the song 'Janaab-e-Aali', which will be released directly in theatres.

Big studios are not filmmakers, they're business guys: Jackie ChanAction star Jackie Chan expressed that modern big-budget productions now seem driven less by passion and more by profit margins. Calling them business guys at an event, Chan said the Hollywood industry is not the same creative playground it used to be.

Aditya Roy Kapur opens up on being praised more for looks than actingAditya Roy Kapur said people often notice his looks more than his acting, but he doesn't let it affect him. The actor focused on his work, believing that over time, talent will always speak for itself.

Tom Holland poses with fans in BTS moments from Spider-Man: Brand New Day shootTom Holland shared behind-the-scenes moments from the 'Spider-Man: Brand New Day' shoot, enjoying fan interactions on set for the first time. The film, shot in Glasgow, marks his fourth time donning the iconic Spider-Man suit and is set to release in July 2026.

Bibliophile Princess: Anime for girls with book in one hand and dream in otherFall in love with 'Bibliophile Princess', the anime every book girl needs. Romance, royalty, and a female lead who'd rather read than mingle.

Mass Jathara teaser: Ravi Teja, Sreeleela film promises mass masala entertainer'Mass Jathara' is an upcoming Telugu film starring Ravi Teja and Sreeleela in the lead. Directed by Bhanu Bhogavarapu, the commercial entertainer is slated to release in theatres on August 27.

Code of Silence review: Well-woven crime series with emotional depthRelease Date:Fri Aug 01, 2025Code of Silence series review: 'Code of Silence' on LionsgatePlay narrates the emotional journey of a hearing-impaired protagonist who is part of a police investigation. Is the show worth your time? Here is our review.

US man confused over Coolie craze, Indians give him a Rajinikanth power class When a US man stumbled upon sold-out 'Coolie' shows and sky-high ticket prices, he turned to X for answers, and Rajinikanth fans happily schooled him on the Superstar's God-like craze.

RM hits 3 billion solo streams, joins SUGA and J-Hope in milestoneBTS leader RM has achieved a remarkable milestone by crossing 3 billion solo streams on Spotify, joining fellow members SUGA and J-Hope in this elite group.

War 2 advance booking: Hrithik-Jr NTR's spy saga sells over 67,000 tickets for Day 1The advance booking for 'War 2' opened recently, and the spy saga has been performing decently so far. Starring Hrithik Roshan and Jr NTR in the lead, the film is yet to see a massive hike in its sales in Andhra Pradesh.

Hansika Motwani's cryptic birthday post hints at new lessons amid divorce rumoursOn her 34th birthday, Hansika Motwani shared a heartfelt Instagram story hinting at unforeseen challenges. In a cryptic post, she wrote about learning lessons that she didn't ask for amid growing rumours about her divorce from Sohael Khaturiya.

BLACKPINK to return with new mini-album this November: ReportsK-pop girl group Blackpink are rumoured to release a mini-album in November amid their ongoing 'Deadline World Tour'. Fans await official confirmation as the group continues to break records globally.

Baaghi 4 teaser: Tiger Shroff-Sanjay Dutt serve violence with side of trigger alertThe teaser of 'Baaghi 4' starring Tiger Shroff and Sanjuay Dutt is out. The video is nothing short of violence, gruesome, and vengeance served with power-packed action sequences.

Farhan Akhtar-backed Boong selected as Spotlight film at Melbourne festival'Boong', a Manipuri film backed by Farhan Akhtar, has been chosen as the Spotlight Film at the Indian Film Festival of Melbourne 2025, highlighting its growing international acclaim and the promising debut of director Lakshmipriya Devi.

Jr NTR beyond RRR: From legacy launch to global sensationFrom a child artist in 'Bala Ramayanam' to an actor commanding global attention, Jr NTR's journey has been one of relentless evolution. He is now waiting for the release of 'War 2', his big Bollywood debut.

John Abraham on Saiyaara's success: Aditya Chopra's faith in newcomers workedJohn Abraham praises Aditya Chopra's faith in newcomers following Saiyaara's success. He also discusses Tehran's OTT release on Zee5 and hopes for theatres to coexist with digital platforms.

Ananya Panday, Suhana Khan enjoy movie night with AbRam. WatchAnanya Panday and Suhana Khan recently stepped out for a movie night in Mumbai with Suhana's younger brother, AbRam. A video from their outing has emerged online.

general news.headline: Nuclear sabre-rattling Pak's stock-in-trade: India on Asim Munir's threatIndia strongly condemned Pakistan Army Chief Asim Munir's nuclear threat issued from US soil, calling Pakistan's nuclear sabre-rattling a habitual tactic and warning that India will not succumb to such blackmail.

Top court orders immediate capture of Delhi-NCR stray dogs, warns against interferenceThe Supreme Court ordered Delhi-NCR authorities to urgently catch, sterilise, and permanently relocate stray dogs to shelters, warning that any individual or organisation obstructing the process would face legal action.

Karnataka Minister axed over 'voter list revision during Congress rule' remarkKarnataka minister KN Rajanna resigned after voter fraud remarks during the Congress era upset the high command. The controversy coincides with Rahul Gandhi's accusations against the Election Commission for hiding evidence of BJP's vote manipulation in 2024 polls.

Rahul Gandhi detained, Mahua Moitra faints at chaotic 'vote chori' protestNearly 300 Opposition MPs, led by Rahul Gandhi, marched to the Election Commission in Delhi on Monday over alleged electoral malpractices, but the protest was blocked by the Delhi Police, resulting in several detentions.

How Modi outsmarted Trump, avoided photo-op trapUS President Donald Trump's Nobel Peace Prize ambitions have him collecting photos with warring world leaders. Last week, Trump turned "peacemaker" again and got Azerbaijan's President Ilham Aliyev and Armenian PM Nikol Pashinyan in a single frame. He's trying the same for Putin and Zelenskyy in Alaska. However, PM Narendra Modi outsmarted Trump and didn't fall into a photo-op trap with Pakistan's Asim Munir in June.

Why Asim Munir chose the US for his nuclear threat to half the worldPakistan Army chief Asim Munir's nuclear threat from US soil signals more than bluster. It's a calculated move to play to domestic hardliners, try to unsettle India, and leverage warming ties with Donald Trump's Washington DC, just when India-US ties have hit a rough patch. It came on the day the US dropped the atom bomb on Nagasaki, 80 years ago.

ChatGPT 5 hints AI surge finally slowing but humans are still cookedIf ChatGPT 5 is any indication, then it seems the era of "transformers" is over. What comes next in AI is not yet certain. Except that it is already smarter than humans in many aspects.

From the India Today archives (2000) | Kaun Banega Crorepati: Big B's small-screen gamble 25 years ago'Lock' the date: August 11 is when Amitabh Bachchan will be on your TV screen hosting the 17th season of Kaun Banega Crorepati
Flouting laws, risking lives: How unregulated play schools endanger childrenAre our daycares really safe for children?

Age of consent for sex: Why a 160-year-old debate is still ragingThe government told the Supreme Court that bringing down the age of consent for sex from 18 would make girls vulnerable to predators. In 1860, the IPC criminalised sex with a girl under 10. The age of consent was increased to 14 and 16, in 1925 and 1940, respectively. Why the age of consent, set at 18 in 2013, is being debated?

Israel marked Al Jazeera reporter Anas al-Sharif for death a year agoAnas Al Sharif was killed in an Israeli airstrike in Gaza City alongside four other Al Jazeera journalists. Sharif was a Palestinian journalist known for reporting from northern Gaza during the Israel-Hamas conflict. But the Israeli Defence Force (IDF) accused him of being a Hamas operative way back in October 2024.

Fur and fury: Top court order for removal of stray dogs triggers backlash from PETA and othersAnimal welfare experts warn that Delhi's new stray dog removal order could backfire, undoing decades of rabies control, straining civic resources, and leaving both people and dogs worse off.

Gujarat man and lion startle each other after chance encounter. Video goes viralA man had a rare close encounter with a lion near a cement factory in Gujarat late at night. A video of the moment has gone viral on social media.

Asim Munir compares India to Mercedes, Pakistan to dump truck. Self-goal, says InternetAsim Munir's 'India is a Mercedes and Pakistan a dump truck' remark had the internet calling it a self-goal and questioning why Pakistan's Army Chief made such a comment.

Children of H-1B visa holders could lose Green Card rights; Indians to be hitStarting August 15, the Trump administration will change how age is calculated under the Child Status Protection Act, impacting thousands of children of H-1B visa holders, mainly Indians. Using the State Department's Final Action Dates chart may cause those turning 21 during processing to lose protected status. Applications filed earlier follow the old rules.

Borrowed cash from a friend? You may end up paying income tax penaltyThe income tax department is strict when it comes to large cash transactions. Whether it's taking a loan, repaying one, or even making donations, there are limits you need to follow. Go beyond those, and you could face a penalty equal to the entire amount involved.

I attended a fake wedding party in Delhi, and this is how it wentLehengas and sarees? Check. Mehndi artist? Check. Marigolds and fairy lights? Check. An elaborate food spread? Umm… not quite. Here's a peek inside a fake wedding event in Delhi.

Mob vandalises tomb outside UP mausoleum, claims it is built on top of temple A group of people from a Hindu organisation vandalised a tomb outside a mausoleum in Uttar Pradesh's Fatehpur, claiming the complex was built on top of temple.

From ban to profit sharing: Inside US deal with Nvidia, AMD on China chip salesThe deal makes the US a direct financial beneficiary of sensitive technology sales to a geopolitical rival. This article looks into the key details of this first-of-its-kind agreement.
Now 'Cat Kumar', son of 'Catty Boss', applies for ID proof in BiharA 'Cat Kumar', son of 'Catty Boss', applied for a residential certificate in Bihar, leading to a police case and investigation.

Homeschooled 17-year-old refutes 40-year-old math theory, heads straight to PhDAt just 17, homeschooled Bahamas teen Hannah Cairo upended the 40-year-old Mizohata-Takeuchi conjecture, coming up with a counterexample where none was thought possible. Now, she is headed straight for a PhD, without any high school diploma or college degree.

Why 'Make in India' still depends so much on China-made goodsWhen Prime Minister Narendra Modi launched the 'Make in India' programme in 2014, it was meant to transform India into a global manufacturing hub, create millions of jobs, and reduce dependence on imports, especially from China.

Why urban hobosexuality is quite a thing in India now (or at least becoming one)Hobosexuality refers to a pattern where someone enters a romantic relationship primarily for housing or financial support, often under the guise of a deep emotional connection.

Coolie advance booking storm: Rajinikanth on track for Rs 100 crore Day 1 rampageRajinikanth's 'Coolie' is rewriting box office history even before release, raking in over Rs 51 crore in Day 1 pre-sales and eyeing a Rs 100 crore global opening - a record-breaking storm for Tamil cinema.

Baaghi 4 X reactions: Is Tiger being Animal? Fans spot similarities with Ranbir's filmTiger Shroff's 'Baaghi 4' teaser is out. The clip left mixed reactions from fans, with many believing certain scenes were similar to Ranbir Kapoor's 'Animal'.

Jr NTR's fan once told him he'd die for him, War 2 actor shares emotional storyOverwhelmed by the fans' reaction at the 'War 2' event in Hyderabad, Jr NTR recalled how his fans had stood by him for decades - even when he was still making his way into the film industry.

Dhadak 2 Anubha Fatehpuria: Impossible to be unaware of casteism in today's timeBollywood actor Anubha Fatehpuria shares her experience playing a mother confronting casteism in 'Dhadak 2'. She also discusses the challenges of juggling her acting and architecture careers while highlighting cinema's role in social change.

She also reflected on actor Ibrahim Ali Khan's acting skills following the mixed reactions to his performance.

sports.headline: Was Maxwell's sensational catch vs SA legal according to new ICC rules?Glenn Maxwell's jaw-dropping boundary catch against South Africa sparked debate under the ICC's updated fielding laws. Here's how his effort stacked up against the new one-touch rule — and why it was perfectly legal.

Prithvi Shaw went down wrong path and spoilt his career: Rohit Sharma's coachRohit Sharma's childhood coach Dinesh Lad recently recalled Prithvi Shaw's rise to international cricket and said that he went down the wrong path to destroy his career.

South Africa may not reach WTC final 2027, Sri Lanka have better chance: ChopraFormer India cricketer Aakash Chopra said that Sri Lanka have a better chance of reaching the World Test Championship (WTC) final in 2027 than defending champions South Africa. He believes that sub-continent tours will pose a threat to South Africa in this cycle.

India in continuous dialogue phase with IOC about 2036 Olympic bid: Sports MinistryIndia's bid to host the 2036 Olympics is currently in the continuous dialogue phase with the IOC's Future Host Commission. The host selection process is paused as the IOC reassesses future election procedures amid doping concerns.

Chelsea boss Maresca upbeat about Premier League campaign after fine pre-seasonChelsea boss Enzo Maresca is upbeat about the upcoming Premier League campaign as the Blues defeated AC Milan to cap off a fine pre-season. Chelsea defeated Milan 4-1 on Sunday, August 10.

Harmanpreet Kaur sets sights on World Cup glory at home: Want to break barriersIndia women's cricket team captain Harmanpreet Kaur has set her sights on ending the team's ICC Trophy drought by winning the upcoming World Cup at home.

Vengsarkar backs Gambhir in Oval curator spat, hits out at Hayden's remarkDilip Vengsarkar came in support of Gautam Gambhir for his spat with Oval pitch curator, Lee Fortis, during the England tour. Vengsarkar slammed Matthew Hayden for his remark about the spat between Gambhir and Fortis.

India are missing a player like Hardik Pandya in Tests: Craig McMillanNew Zealand women's cricket team head coach Craig McMillan feels India are missing someone like Hardik Pandya in their Test line up.

Hardik Pandya set to undergo fitness assessment in NCA ahead of Asia CupHardik Pandya is set for a crucial fitness test at the NCA ahead of Asia Cup 2025, with selectors closely monitoring his readiness and Suryakumar Yadav's recovery to strengthen India's white-ball hopes.

Wish Bumrah played all Tests, who remembers wickets taken in IPL?: VengasarkarFormer India batter and chief selector Dilip Vengasarkar said that Jasprit Bumrah should've played all the Tests in the recently concluded five-match series against England as nobody remembers IPL performances.

Liverpool boss Arne Slot refuses to panic after Community Shield lossLiverpool boss Arne Slot doesn't feel there is a need to panic after their penalty shootout loss to Crystal Palace in the Community Shield on Sunday, August 10. Liverpool let the lead slip twice during the game and lost 2-3 in the shoot-out.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
